title: Compiler segfault when using type_alias_impl_trait

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following code segfaults the compiler:

### Code

```Rust
#![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)]

use std::future::Future;

fn main() {
    let _ = move || async move {
        let value = 0u8;
        blah(&value).await;
    };
}

type BlahFut<'a> = impl Future<Output = ()> + Send + 'a;
fn blah<'a>(_value: &'a u8) -> BlahFut<'a> {
    async {}
}
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.60.0-nightly (21b4a9cfd 2022-01-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 21b4a9cfdcbb1e76f4b36b5c3cfd64d627285093
commit-date: 2022-01-27
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.60.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
